intro: Cistanthera parvifolia, commonly known as the small-flowered cistanthera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in heathlands and dry forests, preferring well-drained soils. Cistanthera parvifolia is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
